Expectation1: Help out during difficult times or emergencies.
Situation1: A I04iend on their way to the airport calls, thinking they left their passport at home, and asks if you can check and bring it to them right away.
Expectation2: Ensure compliance with safety and regulatory standards
Situation2: A recently updated standard will apply to the upcoming release, and evidence of conformity is required
Story: My phone buzzed just as I was reviewing the checklist for our product’s compliance documentation. The new safety standard was going into effect tomorrow, and I was the lead engineer responsible for ensuring every box was ticked before the release. My manager had made it clear: any slip-up could mean a costly delay and a hit to our reputation. As I scrolled through the requirements, my phone rang again—this time, it was Sam, my oldest friend. He sounded frantic. “I think I left my passport at home. I’m almost at the airport. Can you check and bring it if it’s there? My flight’s in two hours.” I glanced at the clock, heart pounding. If I left now, I’d barely make it back in time to finish the compliance report. But Sam had always been there for me, and missing his flight would ruin his long-awaited trip. My mind raced, torn between the urgent needs of my job and the desperate plea of a friend who counted on me.
